eu_initiatives:
The activities are carried out in in the framework of 5 multiannual programmes encompassing research/analysis, expert seminars, public conferences and publications: European Politics and Institutions (EPI), European Migration and Diversity (EMD); Sustainable Prosperity for Europe (SPE), Social Europe & Wellbeing (SEW) and Europe in the World (EIW), as well as 2 flagship projects, Connecting Europe and FutureLab Europe project. 
For more information and for details of the individual projects, see the Programmes section on our website: 
http://www.epc.eu/prog_intro.php
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership: The EPC has an international network of around 360 member organisations divided into the following main categories: corporate; professional and business associations, diplomatic, non-governmental organisations, foundations, regional and local authorities. the latest list of members can be found on our website: http://www.epc.eu/members_list.php
goals__remit:
The European Policy Centre (EPC) is an independent, not-for-profit think tank dedicated to fostering European integration through analysis and debate, supporting and challenging European decision-makers at all levels to make informed decisions based on evidence and analysis, and providing a platform for engaging partners, stakeholders and citizens in EU policy-making and in the debate about the future of Europe. 
 
In line with its multi-constituency approach, members of the EPC comprise companies, professional and business federations, trade unions, diplomatic missions, regional and local bodies, as well as NGOs representing a broad range of civil society interests, foundations, international and religious organisations. The EPC has around 360 member organisations. Membership changes throughout the year and the latest information can be found on the EPC website which is regularly updated: http://www.epc.eu/members_list
relevant_communication:
In 2017, the EPC organized around 180 events in Brussels.  Over half of the events were public, involving the media, EPC member organizations and officials from the EU institutions and other experts. 
Short summaries of our public events can be found here: http://www.epc.eu/events_rep.php?cat_id=last 
 
The EPC produced 69 publications in 2016 on a range of EU and global policy issues. See our website for all publications in 2016: 
http://www.epc.eu/pub.php?year=2016
